questions.text: Dermatitis herpetifomis is associated with
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Dermatitis herpetiformis is an immunobullous disease which targets tissue transglutaminase. It presents as excoriated papules over elbows, knees and buttocks. The lesions are very itchy. Dapone is an effective therapy. On HPE we get neutrophilic microabcess on tips of dermal papillae. On DIF we get granular IgA deposits. An underlying genetic predisposition to the development of dermatitis herpetiformis has been demonstrated. Both dermatitis herpetiformis and celiac disease (CD) are associated with an increased expression of HLA-A1, HLA-B8, HLA-DR3, and HLA-DQ2/DQ8 haplotypes. Environmental factors are also important; monozygotic twins may have dermatitis herpetiformis, celiac disease, and/or gluten-sensitive enteropathy with variable symptomatology.

questions.text: Xanthoma disseminatum is associated with
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Xanthoma means lipid deposits. Xanthoma disseminatum refers to deposition of lipids inside the histiocytes. Blood lipid levels are normal. It ia a non Langerhans cells histiocytosis which presents as red brown nodules on skin, eye, lungs. This condition may be associated with diabetis insipidus. It manifests with multiple, grouped, red-brown to yellow papules and nodules involving the skin, mucous membranes, and internal organs with a predilection for flexures and the face.

questions.text: In pemphigus, split occurs at the level of
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Phemphigus vulgaris is a blistering disorder which has antibodies against desmoglein 3. It affects both skin and mucosa. Features of phemphigus are • Supra basal blister • Basal layer of cells appear as TOMB STONE • Fish net pattern on immunofluorescence

questions.text: Cayenne Pepper stippling due to hemosiderin is found in
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Plasma cell balanitis of zoon is a condition which causes red, shin, erythema on glans. On biopsy : plasma cells are found. The cayenne peooer staining is due to hemorragic points and hemosiderin deposition .

questions.text: Which of the following is involved in the pathogenesis of dermatitis herpetiformis
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Dermatitis herpetiformis is a skin manifestation of coeliac disease. It the a condition in which the patient is intolerant to the gliadin componenet of gluten. The anti gliadin antibodies of IgA type and anti t- tissue transglutaminase (TTG - 3) enzyme are formed . This anti – TTG antibodies formed in the gut cross reacts with epidermal transglutaminase (ETG)enzyme of skin. ETG is present on tip of dermal papillae. This reaction leads to formation of papillary tip blisters.

questions.text: Which of the following are not the dermatological signs in mitochondrial disorder
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Mitochondrial disorders can be either inherited disorders or may occur due to DNA damge by radiation exposure. The skin manifestations of mitochondrial disorders are bilateral symmetric lipomatosis, acrocyanosis, and acroparesthesia. Most common feature among these is lipomatosis

questions.text: Pautriermicroabscess is seen in which of the following?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) • T cells which are found in dermis, invade the epidermis and forms abcesses known as pautriers micro abcess. This is a histological sign of mycosis fungoides • Psoriasis presents with mmunroe’smicroabcesses which are neutrophilic collection in the epidermis.

questions.text: Wickham striae is seen in
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Wickhamsstriae are white net like pattern seen in oral lichen planus. Thsesestraie can be demonstated in cutaneous lichen planus by applying oil. In oral mucosa it is continuously demonstrated because of presence of saliva. It is also known as lacy or reticular pattern of LP. Wickhams striae are due to underlying hypergranulosis.

choices.text: Contact dermatitis to rubber used in disposable napkins

questions.text: Which of the following is true regarding tide water dermatitis
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Tide water dermatitis is a type of diaper dermatitis in which the edge of diaper which is soaked with urine is exposed to air and there is a continuous cycle of wetness and dryning. this leads to band shaped popular dermatitis.

questions.text: What is the ideal period of contraception advisable after treatment with isotretinoin to avoid any teratogenic effects of the drug on the fetus?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Isotretinoin is a highly teratogenic drug, meaning it can cause severe birth defects if a woman becomes pregnant while taking it or shortly after stopping it. Because of this, strict contraception is required during treatment and for some time afterward to ensure there is no risk of teratogenic effects. The drug has a half-life of 10-20 hours, but its metabolites (such as 4-oxo-isotretinoin) can remain in the body much longer. Therefore, while the drug clears relatively quickly from the system, the safety margin for contraception extends beyond the drug's immediate elimination. Clinical guidelines, including those from the iPLEDGE program (in the U.S.) and the European Medicines Agency, recommend at least 1 month of contraception after stopping isotretinoin to ensure that any residual drug does not impact a potential pregnancy. However, for the most ideal safety, especially in long-term or high-dose users, the recommendation is extended to 3 months. This 3-month period is seen as providing the necessary time for the drug and its metabolites to be fully cleared from the body, significantly reducing the risk of teratogenic effects if pregnancy occurs. This 3-month duration is now widely accepted as the best practice for preventing fetal harm and is consistent with 2025 guidelines, making C. 3 months the most accurate answer in the current context.

questions.text: Which among the following is/are not included in lichen planus
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B And C) Ref: Rook’s Textbook of Dermatology, IADVL Textbook Explanation: Lichen planus (LP) is an inflammatory skin condition with characteristic clinical and histopathological findings. Classic LP typically presents as pruritic, polygonal, violaceous flat-topped papules and plaques; many variants in morphology and location also exist, including oral, nail, linear, annular, atrophic, hypertrophic, inverse, eruptive, bullous, ulcerative, lichen planus pigmentosus, lichen planopilaris, vulvovaginal, actinic, lichen planus-lupus erythematosus overlap syndrome, and lichen planus pemphigoides. Lichen nititdus is an inflammatory dermatosis in children separate from lichen planus Lichen scrofulosorum is a type of cutaneous TB

questions.text: Nail change(s) seen in psoriasis may include which among the following
questions.solution: Correct Answer (ACD) Ref: Roxburg 17th Ed Explanation: Nail changes in psoriasis Also remember that nail plate is thickened, not thinned in psoriasis Pterygium is seen in lichen planus

questions.text: Non Scarring alopecia is seen in all except?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B, C, D AND E) Ref: Harrison 19th Ed, Fitzpatrick Explanation: Tenia capitis, Trichotillomania , Alopecia areata and androgenetic alopecia cause non-scarring alopecia. Other options produce scarring alopecia.

questions.text: Langerhans cells in skin are reduced or absent in
questions.solution: Correct Answer (AE) Ref: IJDVL Review article Explanation: Causes of reduced to absent Langerhans cells in skin • Ageing • Basal cell carcinoma of the skin • Squamous cell carcinoma of the skin • Sarcoidosis • HIV/AIDS • HPV infection • Lichenoid drug eruptions

questions.text: Painful genital ulcers are seen in?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (AB) Explanation: HSV and Chancroid produce painful genital ulcers

questions.text: Facies leprosa includes?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A,B,C,D,E) Ref: IADVL Textbook of Leprosy Explanation: Facial features of leprosy • Facies leprosa: Due to bony resorption. Includes loss of anterior nasal spine, loss of upper incisors and resorption of anterior alveolar process of the maxilla • Others:Madarosis (Loss of eyebrows and eyelashes), Collapse of nasal bridge, Leonine facies due to diffuse infiltration of the skin

questions.text: True about dermatitis herpetiformis is/are?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A, B,C, E) Dermatitis herpetiformis is an immunobullous disease which targets tissue transglutaminase. It presents as excoriated papules over elbows, knees and buttocks. The lesions are very itchy. Dapone is an effective therapy. On HPE we get neutrophilic microabcess on tips of dermal papillae. On DIF we get granular IgA deposits.

questions.text: Leprosy occurs as zoonoses in?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B,C, D) Animal models in leprosy are chimpanzee, nine banded armadillo and managbay monkey. In these animals leprosy is transmissible to humans as zoonoses.

questions.text: Kit-1 for cervical disease, urethral disease and inguino-scrotal swellings includes?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A, C) Kit 1 has azithromycin 1g stat and cefixime 400mg stat.

questions.text: Wound healing is delayed in?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A,B,C,D) Factors delaying wound healing are • Systemic factors 1. Increased age 2. Malnutrition 3. Smoking, alcoholism 4. Diabetis, malignancy 5. Connective tissue disorders 6. Chronic renal failure 7. Obesity • Local factors (a) Vascular compromise: arterial or venous (b) Neuropathy (c) Pressure (d) Infected wound (e) Increased necrotic tissue (f) Local malignancy

choices.text: More than two simple or one plexiform neurofibroma

questions.text: All of the following are criteria of neurofibromatosis type 1 except?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) • NF type 1 also called von recklinghausen’s disease. This has skin manifestations. Axillary freckling/ crows sign is pathognomic of NF-1. Lisch nodules are pigmented iris hamartoma seen on slit lamp examination. • NF type 2 has acoustic neuroma

questions.text: A 20 years-old male patient presented with the lesion which he had been having since last 4 years as shown in the image. The lesion had hairs and was hyper pigmented. What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) a. BECKER’S NEVUS • Site: back/shoulder area • Brown coloured and hairy • Male> female due to DHT • Adolescent age group b. Nevus of ota is found on face c. Spitz nevus is nevus of melanocytes, not hairy and not brown

questions.text: 50 years-old male present with painless lesion on dorsum of hand as shown in figure. Causative organism is?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) • Cauliflower shaped masses seen called warts. These are caused by human papilloma virus. • Pox virus has popular lesions with central umbilication • Herpes virus shows group blisters

questions.text: A 10-years-old girl with family history of allergy presents with following lesions on her cubital fossa as shown in image. The lesions are extremely itchy with winter exacerbation and similar lesions are present in her seborrheic area and popliteal fossa. What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) ATOPIC DERMATITIS • Cubital fossa or flexural areas are classical sites for atopic dermatitis in adults and children above 2 years • Eczema exaggerated by winter • Co-existing seborrheic dermatitis may be present

questions.text: Cutis marmorata is caused by?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) • Cutis: skin, marmorata: criss-cross / reticulate/lacy pattern • It is a physiological phenomenon in neonates due to underdeveloped vasculature • Exposure to cold causes stasis of circulation resulting in engorged vessels. These are seen prominently as reticulate pattern. • This pattern disappears once warmth is given

questions.text: A child scratches his hand with a pen. A red wheal appears which persists for 30 minutes. What would be the diagnosis-
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Dermographism is scratching induced urticarial. The red lines caused due to this are transient (30 min)

questions.text: The causative organism of the condition shown below
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) • Erythema in skin folds known as intertrigo. The image also shows satellite lesions • Commonest cause of intertrigo is candidiasis

choices.text: Both dermis and epidermis are derived from ectoderm
Skin accounts for total 15% of body weight
Most of the cells in skin are keratinocytes derived from ectoderm
Dermis is made up of type 1 and type 2 collagen in 3:2 ratio

questions.text: All are true about skin except
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) The ratio of Type 1 to type 3 collagen in skin is not 3:2.

questions.text: A child with history of fever, photosensitivity, rash sparing nasolabial fold presents to OPD. Identify the condition.
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) • SLE spares nasolabial folds • Rosacea involves nasolabial folds • DLE has photosensitivity presents as plaque. Not a rash

questions.text: Patient presents with pruritis of interdigits of left hand as shown in the image. identify the condition?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Scabies caused by sarcoptes scabei.

questions.text: Identify the condition given below of a child with asthmatic mother
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) ATOPIC DERMATITIS ATOPIC DERMATITIS • Cubital fossa or flexural areas are classical sites for atopic dermatitis in adults and children above 2 years. Cheeks are common site in children <2yrs • Eczema exaggerated by winter • Co-existing seborrheic dermatitis may be present

questions.text: Identify the condition shown below.
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Alopecia areata has patchy loss of hair. It is associated with regular pitting of nails

questions.text: Identify the condition given in image below
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) • Vitiligo is a disorder of melanocytes where melanocytes are detroyed by immune system • May or maynot be associated with loss of iris pigmentation

choices.text: May be an indication for skin malignancy
May be associated with insulin resistant diabetes mellitus
Commonly occurs in lean and thin people

questions.text: Which of the following regarding the condition depicted in the image is correct
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) ACANTHOSIS NIGRICANS • Velvety blackness in folds seen in back of neck • May indicate gastric adeno carcinoma, insulin resistant diabetis mellitus • Seen in obese people
